review: The wedge salad was delicious, the mac n cheese burger incredible,service was fine. I can't believe they charged me a dollar for 4 slices of jalapeño, I paid 2 cents for a Whole one at the market yesterday. Ridiculous. Next time I'll bring my own it will be fresh,not the trash they served me it was mushy. I still can't believe it. If you're going to charge it should at least be fresh.

My husband and I stopped in Thursday evening , after a movie.  No waiting, we were in a booth with drinks and menus in under 10 minutes.  When a issue arose with my order, it was corrected immediately with no fuss.  After this, we weren't ignored as can happen after a complaint.  In fact, our server Joshua and his trainee, Zoe, were fantastic!  Sometimes mistakes just happen, it is how they are corrected that is remembered.  Great service & a wonderful meal.  Thank you!

I told my brother that i wanted to taste some good burgers, and then he told about this particular place, i had never eaten such an amazingly awesome tasting burger (Fiery Ghost Tavern) is the name i get it all the time, spicy as hell but the taste! mmm... and then the bottomless fries!!! seriously closed the deal, i have been going there ever since. (about 4 times now) and i don't regret it, the service is great, friendly staff, i would seriously recommend it.
I have visited this Red Robin several times since my initial review and I must say my experiences have been great. I will continue to go to this Red Robin going forward.

After some afternoon shooting we decided to get some burgers at Red Robin. This was their famed burger with a runny egg on it. "Gourmet". This was hardly gourmet but they had a nice selection of different burgers on it. Even with bacon, this was sadly still very much a backyard burger. I was pretty disappointed since it cost around $10USD. The runny egg seemed like a delicious endeavor at first, but ended up becoming a runny mess, most of which just ended up on my plate. Much to more dismay, my fries was but a small cup. I realized later this was similar to places like Eureka! in Claremont, but at least RR had unlimited fries. Which kept coming in small batches. WHYYYY. I felt like I was eating a watery burger because the lettuce and tomato had absolutely no flavor. This was just an epic fail of food. If you want a real burger, go to Pie Dog in Fullerton, or G Burger in La Habra. If you're feeling adventurous, my number one place is still Golden State off of Fairfax in Los Angeles. Those are real gourmet burgers.

We lifted our cup of fries and discovered: The cup is bottomless. Oh wait, HAHAHAHAHA. I've only ever been to this Red Robin location. I come here randomly once a year, so I may be biased.  In short, I like this place. It's a pretty chill vibe, they got lots of burgers, and bottomless fries. I've gotten different burgers every visit and I liked 'em all (Wolverine Burger, Monster Burger, Chicken BBQ River ??? Burger to name a few).  The only thing I don't like about this place is this: the cup of fries is small. I need to hail a server every 10 minutes because I just demolish mine instantly. I usually come here with a few friends and eat slowly. If you eat at any kind of respectable pace, you'll be hailing constantly.  Servers are nice about it. More fries? Yeah, of course! After the first time, they give you a plate of fries. And this plate of fries probably fits into your bottomless cup (it's like 1/4 of the plate). So this place is pretty stingy with fries... But a $10 burger is typical at other restaurants (Tahoe Joe's, Mimi's Cafe, Smashburger are all like $7-$10) without bottomless fries. Considering that, it's a pretty good deal. Even if you gotta stack up plates on plates of extra orders of free fries.

Note: The iPads on the table charge money if you want to play games. Seriously, any kid can bypass the "parental consent" and just start playing games. Just beware, so you won't be shocked when the bill comes and there is an extra charge.  The burgers here are pretty good and there are a lot of choices to choose from. They are offering ramen burgers now. I think everyone can agree that the unlimited fries are what keeps them coming. The freckled lemonade also comes with free refills. In the end, it's a pretty good deal. They have "healthier options" now where you can substitute buns and have your burger wrapped in lettuce (think protein style burger from In-n-Out). I opted for that option to make myself feel better about devouring some fries. You can also order broccoli or beans instead of fries. I also saw some gluten free options too, for those of you who are allergic to gluten.  A lot of families frequently come here and I can see why. The food is plentiful and there are lots of different choices for everybody.

If I could give zero stars I would.  We had a party of 4 adults and two kids. The restaurant was empty but we had to wait 15 mins to be seated which was understandable I guess if they wanted to set up an area for us... We finally were seated where we waited another 15 mins with hungry kids and no one even came to take our drink order. We had to leave because we are hungry. My dad tried to talk to a manager just to let them know we were forgot about.. when the "waitress" or whoever was ignoring us walked up to tell the manager that that's not how it went down. Which is completely rude. We were only in town to go to the pumpkin patch down the street but I will never recommend this Red Robin to anyone. Thanks chumps. Just go to the in and out next door.
I've never had a bad experience at this Red Robin.  The bottomless fries are great & servers do a good job of checking up on the customers.
I've been meaning to update this review.  They no longer blast the music so you can now speak with you dining partners.  It's been that way for years.  I'm just slow to update.
5 stars ! The food was delicious. Ordered the salmon plate and a burger with garlic fries. Customer service is also 5 stars!!

Can't go wrong with the Whiskey River Brbq Burger. Best burger off the menu! I mainly will stop by for the bottomless steak fries w/season salt and Ranch..Yummmmm..  **Ask for a basket of fries ahead of time, to munch on until your food arrives.

OK, my sister and I grew up in Chino (basically all our lives) and we have known this place to be pretty good and a "go-to" spot when we were younger.  It's sad, but this place has changed a lot.  And for the worse. It was happy hour time and we ordered nachos to start our dinner. When it came out, I took the first bite into the nachos, but my peripheral vision saw something moving next to the chip where I had grabbed my first bite. Low and behold! It's this itsy bitsy spider! OMG! with a web attached to it.  So disgusting!!! I picked it up to make sure I saw what I had thought I saw and yes, it was a spider all right!  Yea, so I lost my appetite on the nachos... Overall, a 1 star is pretty sufficient with this place.  Don't think I'll be back here again.

After a long day, I was in some serious need of comfort food (aka bottomless fries).  Red Robin is generally known for a good burger but tonight it was the service that won my praise.  Our server, Michelle P anticipated our every need before we asked.  From the moment she greeted us, we truly had a wonderful dining experience.   I couldn't have felt more welcome
This locations makes a better burger than West Covina location.  Better service and wait staff too.

Great service, Michelle was very nice and very at tentative to us. Better than the Rancho location. Here, the food taste much more fresh and not all cold, meat is cooked very well when you ask for some pink, spot on! You'll love this place if you love French fries! Bottomless fries with every order! I really love coming to red robin!

Ordered to  pick up some boneless wings they were super dry An didn't give me my Yukon chips everything was cold I got there An my ordered wasn't ready this is my 2cd time going there 1st it was so good the wings were saucy An hot An had my Yukon chips perfect but today idont know what happened I am unsatisfied An sucks because I was really craving them an it didn't go well

Not good the manger said he will take care of it he did not it's been over a week now and still no email food was cold and the  soup  was like yesterday's it was not busy at all , Milk shakes was like water

The evening started off well.  The sever came by shortly after we were seated and started our order.  They were demonstrating a new tabletop device that customers can use to order food directly.  I wanted an appetizer wedge and the server showed me how to order it.  Our server assured me that the salad would on it's way quickly because the order had been transmitted directly to the kitchen.  He then took the rest of our order in the traditional way.  About 20 minutes passed and no salad was delivered our server also never made it back to the table.  The rest of the meal was delivered and the server basic dropped it and dashed.  Another 5 minutes and the salad showed it.  It looked really good but by this point in the meal I no longer wanted it and sent it back.  No one ever checked back with and we had to use the call button to get someone over to for drink refills.  When the time came to pay I had have the manager come over to remove the salad from the bill, which had not been done proactively when I refused it.  The manager apologized for the poor service and gave me a $10 gift card as compensation.  I like the idea of the tableside device to get order and get the attention of server but in this case it served to disconnect us from the servers who relied on it to heavily and did not provide any kind of proactive service. Besides the difficulty with the device and the service the food was good and prepared to our specifications.  They do need to work on their bottomless fries.  All to often they have arrived cold and it's been difficult to get refills.   I've had many good experiences at Red Robin and hope this was one was just a blip.

Wow Julianne was the best waitress I've ever had. She brought samples, got my allergy-specific order right, and was polite and friendly. The food was of course delicious as always, but because of the good service, I'll return. :)

I ordered the Black & Bleu Burger. It was one of the tastiest burgers I've ever eaten. Lots of flavor and everything was fresh, including the soft ciabatta bun.  They also have good steak cut fries, unlimited.  Great service and friendly staff. Highly recommended.

This place is garbage. Fries were not seasoned, they were naked. The burgers, gross. The seating was uncomfortable. White ladies next to us were cussing like sailors. Only good thing was the cute hostess. She fine. Everything else..... GARBAGE ***update-  One pizookie from bj's is better than bitchass Red Robin's.

We picked up an order for four. The three burgers were good, my cod sandwich was soggy,  no taste or enough tartar sauce. The chili cheese fries were a ripoff the chili was all dry with stale old fries.  The fries were horrible and stale.  Won't order online again. Not worth it, won't go back to this location

I LOVE the food here but, sadly, the hostess at the front started it off as a bad experience.  The last time we were here, there was no body at the hostess stand. We waited,  and waited, finally  7minutes later someone looks our way and acknowledged us. Today, no one was there again, we only waited 2 minutes this time to leave our names BUT the hostess never looked at us, and never smiled. We watched her take other people's names and same response. No smile. However, our waitress saved the grace of the restaurant. Courtney was so pleasant, friendly and helpful.  And we would go back because of people like Courtney. :-)  My burger was delish! But let's face it, if the service sucks, you won't return,  right?

The servers looked grungy. Greasy unkept hair. Half the servers when I looked around seemed to all have the look of 'i just woke up and rolled out of bed'. The drinks we're flat. The appetizer and meal all came out at once. Then the server stated 'its because the kitchen is backed up'. 1) it's lunch hour. 2) not busy dinning area at all, open tables everywhere. The fries on my plate we're soft and not fully cooked. The manager did comp my appetizer even though I didn't even ask.

Red Robin... Yummmmm... Haha. That is forever stuck in my head. We have these commercials in Oregon. But no Red Robin! Haha. Just moved to SoCal. Haven't seen one commercial. Go figure! When we walked in, we were super confused. There is a host podium, but no host. No sign stating seat yourself. So we stood there for a minute, as staff walked by. Decided, welp, let's just sit. Apparently that was the thing to do. Someone came and gave us menus.  It was lunch hour, but not terribly busy. Maybe half full. But it still took 25 minutes for our food to come out. We had to scarf it down, to ge back to work in time. (We did, with 4 minutes to spare! Yesss!) I got the original burger, which I asked for well done. It was still pink in the middle. Grrr! No time to send it back. I delt with it. It was good. But, they aren't the best. Garlic fries don't have very much garlic. But they were good.  My husband got the french dip, I think it was called. That was pretty darn good! I wish I had ordered that. It came with cole slaw, which was also good.  Our server was on top of things. Asked if we wanted refills. Asked how we were a few times.  We will be back. Maybe when we have more time. Definetly want to try some of their cocktails.
They have great salads. I like sitting in their bar and watching my favorite sport events.

Really good burgers. I just don't like the fact I came on my birthday and wanted a drink but my license expired the day of my birthday and I forgot my temporary one but she would not let me get a drink  I'm 28 btw

I love this red robin location especially because its not located inside a mall lol. This location still gets packed but the wait time is not bad at all. I usually go straight to the bar (if your 21+) the servers at the bar attend you right away and keep the drinks and fries coming. This location has the best employees very friendly and they try to hook you up. LOVE IT.  must try the Patron margarita PERFECT & REFRESHING they get it right EVERY time.

Red Robin is, in my opinion, the best place to fulfill your food cravings. The service here is always very friendly, the food is amazing, and the design and decorations are cool and trendy. *Banzai Burger w/ lettuce bun & vegan boca patty (5/5): This burger is amazing! It has 2 grilled pineapple slices, ranch, teriyaki sauce, tomato, and melted cheese on the vegan boca patty all put together between lettuce buns. *Donut Ring Tower (5/5): These donuts are seriously AMAZING. It's really unique because it tastes like a donut but at the same time like a cronut??? The donut is soft and chewy with the outside coated with sugar. It's the perfect sweetness and paired with the chocolate sauce is even better! The donut tower comes with a side of chocolate sauce & strawberry sauce. I like the chocolate sauce the best :) *BBQ Whiskey River Burger (5/5): This is my Red Robin go-to order. It's probably one of the best burgers at red robin. This burger has lettuce, tomatoes, mayonnaise, melted cheddar, bourbon infused Whiskey River BBQ sauce, crispy onion straws, and a beef patty all put together between 2 warm buns. I love how the burger's not overkill & greasy like other fast food restaurants. The bbq sauce is the key component in the burger and I love how it tastes and brings the entire burger to life. Amazing. *Onion ring tower (5/5): You can't go wrong with their onion rings. These onion rings are crispy on the outside, but not too greasy and the two sauces that comes with it is delicious too. Dip the onion rings in the sauces and you've got heaven in your mouth. *Root Beer Float (5/5): One of my favorite things here that's a must have for me. I love it even more because it's bottomless, so unlimited root beer float! Their root beer is the best! Every time I want to ensure a great meal experience, I always go to Red Robin. They're amazing and you should definitely give them a try.

What is it about chain restaurants that they think service is not important. I came here and ordered two chicken wraps with bbq sauce. 20 minutes later I still didn't have sauce for the appetizers. I'm not surprised nor impressed. -sp

Always the same, always great! Today we had a real treat - a waitress who left us the fuck alone while we ate. Gotta love it! Ordered through their tablet menu and we had our food in under 5 minutes! The food itself isn't spectacular but it's done right! Thats all I can ask for!

I love RR, me & husband dropped by Sat in early afternoon. Great customer service but burger was ordered well done but came out burnt.  We ordered new $15.49 burgers, with side salad (too skimpy now served on tiny serving plate) and a short order of onion tower, and 2 waters. Bill was $47! Wasnt happy with the food quality

Understaffed and dirty!   Stopped in for  a phoned in-2GO salad and had to wait appx 15mins.   Sat at bar, at only clean spot we could find  and bartender never asked us if we wanted drinks or bothered to clean the filthy bar top.   Idk why i just didn't leave? This was one of the worst experiences in recent memory.  This is definitely a management issue!

I should've known this was gonna be bad when I noticed our waiter had a heart tattoo on his arm dedicated to his mom. That level of douche baggery was only emphasized by the anchor and chain tattoo on the other arm. Someone please call Kat Von D.  I ordered a root beer float for a drink, which I read was bottomless. He shows up with our drinks and hand me a flat half empty glass of root beer with no ice cream, returns with a mug full of runny soft serve. This is not a root beer float. The people at A&W would be wildly offended. I then asked for a traditional float, no side of flat soda and received the most bastardized version of a root beer float this country has ever seen. So I settled and took it, at least he met me half way.  Our appetizer was late, and when our food got here, the fries were cold and the BBQ sauce on my wife's burger looked so dry you'd think it had been sitting there for a week. An do we really have to ask for extra napkins? You seriously expect 1 napkin to hold you over for a BBQ burger, fries and onion rings?? I then mustered the courage to ask for another float (since they're bottomless) and the waiter with the fashionable tattoos told me there were no refills. I said fine, bring me a Coke. He checked the menu and shamefully brought me another float. We survived the meal, at least the hostess was kind enough to find us a booth big enough to fit both carriers for our infant twin daughters.  Unfortunately, due to the annoying experience at this location, I don't plan to be back.

Went for Sunday lunch at the Chino Red Robin. The burgers were good but you get 10 count them French fries. Supposedly unlimited but obviously limited.  We had to ask each time for the two refills with  10 to 11 fries. We won't be back. Our waitress was inattentive I never got my refill on my drink. Had to ask for everything. Also the place was dusty if you look around. Needs a thorough cleaning. Too bad I used to like this place.

I really don't know where to start with this... We ordered a take out order from here and it was by far the most disappointing meal we have had from any restaurant. The quality was horrendous and the food wasn't ready even within 20 minutes after we were told it would be, and was somehow still cold. The chicken wrap we ordered was 99% lettuce and the rest was what I can only imagine was Foster Farms packed rib meat chicken product. It was not in any way fresh and was absolutely some pre-packaged chicken chunks purchased from a store. An embarrassment to pay $11 for. The rest of the food was mediocre at best and we cannot believe we paid for it with our hard earned money. Do not go here if you care about the food you are consuming. McDonalds has better quality food than this.

Love! I use my Rewards card when I go because every 10th item is free, no matter how expensive the item is. My go-to meal is the Spicy Jack Tavern Double, so good and cheap! $6.99 for the burger and bottomless fries. Also, ask for a basket of fries while you wait for your meal as part of the bottomless fries from your order and munch while you wait (: Service is great, food is delivered fast and fresh/hot and if there is room in the bar section, it's self-seating if you don't feel like waiting for a table during busy hours.
Great burgers and lemonade, fries are always great. Nice ambiance and great customer service by Ashley.

Great place to eat, reasonable prices, bottomless fries and drinks are what keeps my family coming here! There's also a few vegan options! We usually get the boca burger & add mustard and other extras in it, with sweet potatoes and regular fries! Our servers have always been great, super attentive! Love the service, recommend 10/10!

I've been here once before on the recommendation of a friend, and that first time was a terrible experience: from a waiter who made me feel stupid for not knowing how to prder a double cheeseburger that wasnt the "kid's one" as he put it, to fries that were not only not well done as I had ordered, but were undercooked entirely. Today I tried to give them another shot, as my fiancee said that she was hungry and it smelled good.  I figured fine, it's been years, and maybe they're better. In my opinion, nothing has changed.  I thought I ordered what was described on the menu as a double cheeseburger with bigger patties "The Big Tavern", but apparently I was wrong, as i only got a single burger, and the waiter didn't show any care for my confusion at all -- very reminiscent of my first time here.  He also forgot my fiancee's ranch and brought her the wrong beer... but maybe it was his first day -- who knows. What bothered me even further is that, as someone who has just started playing Pokemon Go! And was enjoying it, I overheard the two bartender women speaking in a condescending manner about its players "my son plays it... but of course he's also fifteen" etc.  As a location that has been marked as a gym, you may want to embrace the free publicity instead of having your staff alienate the demographic. I love burgers, but you guys wont be seeing my business again.

I come here all the time since I work down the street, and love Red Robin in general. But my experience today was something different. I placed an online order to pick up at 12 during my lunch (which is 30 min), I got an email at 11:50 saying that my order was received through a back up system. I get here and they have no idea what I'm talking about even though I'm showing them the emails. The manager (I'm assuming) grabs an associate Natalie to help me who wasn't the greatest by any means. Took my order by hand and the total was totally different. I showed her my email with the total breakdown and she just says "oh" and does nothing about it. It's now 12:21 and I get to eat while I drive back to work instead of enjoying my now more expensive lunch. Probably won't be back to this RR.

I came to this location a couple weeks ago with some friends. I was a bit disappointed in the service here. They were just too slow! We came in 10 minutes before our reservation and weren't seated until 15 minutes after the reservation (even though the table they seated us at was empty since the moment we walked in). It seemed like the waitress  took a lifetime to get our drinks, food, refills, and check. Maybe they were just too busy.  I ordered the Poppin' Purple Lemonade (Prickly pear lemonade) as I always do, but at this location it was TOO sweet. Its like they put too much sugar syrup and didn't mix it well. I had to add 1/4 of water to it just to dilute the sugar. Food-wise, everything tasted good as it always does. Burgers are huge, steak fries are bottomless. The stack of onion rings were on point. The only complaint I had was that my boyfriend upgraded his steak fries to garlic parmesan (which you now have to pay for) and it was not worth it. They just sprinkled some garlic and a dash of cheese on the same fries. It tasted like the normal fries. If you want some real garlic tasting fries I suggest getting normal steak fries and upgrading the dipping sauce (extra $0.99) to the garlic aioli. Its cheaper and better!  Overall the food is always good. Burgers are delicious and bottomless fries are a plus.

Service was amazing! Fries came out with no hesitation and was fried to perfection.  The wait for the burger was very short.  The waitress was very helpful and eager to help us order and bring the food out.  I especially enjoy that Red Robin is sort of melting the garlic and cheese on the bottomless fries.  As a fries enthusiast, it is very nice to eat.

Need to improve the to go order process... Showed up and gave my name on the orders.  They weren't sure about the order and had to check.  I basically had to redo my order.  Also, the deal they had stated wasn't with a certain side item but they gave it to me anyways so I did appreciate that.  Going to the bar to pickup a to go order is challenging, especially when the bar is full.  It makes more sense to out the responsibility on the host or hostess who have more free time to assist with to go orders. I recommend red robin uses a setup like Chile's.  Chile's has the to go order and pick up process down pat.

I think our server Mariah was absolutely phenomenal. However, I was finishing the rest of my oreo shake and once I got to the bottom I was eating the oreos that were left and ended up chewing on a shard of glass. There was no blood as I bit down with the back of my teeth. I brought this to the manager who wrote it down and told us he will call someone. He didn't come back, but our server told us that he took off the shake....I definitely will not be coming back here again.

This is a nice location... its about the same standards as all other Red Robins. Our experience was fine, nothing great to make note of.  Our bartender was friendly and provided relatively sufficient service, though she was clearly distracted and preoccupied chatting it up with an off-duty coworker. Food and drinks were fine, Burgers had the taste of being on the expo line for a few minutes too long (You can clearly see when your cheese was melted 10 minutes ago), but other than that, no complaints. We'll surely return when we're in the area because we are RR fans. The service wasn't BAD, but wasn't great either.

Gotta love Red Robin, another stomping ground of mine. I love the atmosphere--the 50s imagery, the movies, music, and artistry. They have changed it a bit, with different style seating. The bar high chairs are a little uncomfortable unfortunately. I also see that some prices have gone up, which I'm not too wild about. The food has always been great. They always cook our burgers to order and it's always very hot and fresh. The best thing about Red Robin, I think, is their burgers. Not only are they creative with styles and flavoring, but those burgers are ORGANIZED. You know what I mean, like the TV commercials that advertise burgers that look so luscious and clean, they could be made of plastic? That's how Red Robin burgers look. You can tell that they really care about their food presentation. It's on point.  My favorites are the Onion Ring Stack, Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger, The Orange Cream Soda, and the Mud Pie--all to die for! They also have really delicious shakes! Their portion sizes are enough to make you wish you'd worn your stretchy pants. Overall, the service is great with very few lags, the atmosphere is fun, the place is always squeaky clean, and the food is scrumptious!

My husband and I where here last weekend after spending an hour with the tax lady.  We wanted to have a nice dinner (also our 12th year Wedding Anniversary), and stopped to have a nice dinner.  All I wanted was a bowl of French Onion soup and a half a sandwich.  I got was a lukewarm soup in a sauce bowl (3 spoonfuls) and a full order of a turkey croissant sandwich.  The menu said soup and a half sandwich.  My husband got the peppercorn burger and he said it was ok.  The next day, which was our actual Anniversary, my husband was not feeling well with a bad stomachache.  Next year during tax time, we are never stepping into Red Robin in Chino again.

I want to let everyone know how the staff takes care of there customers! We were in there tonight, in the bar area, my wife who is suffering from Alzheimer's disease had to use the restroom, well she is at the stage she needs help! So I took her over to the restroom and she wanted me to come in there, while she went (Pee-shot-tee) pee! I told I can't go in there, but she doesn't understand, then goes in and come right back out! So I told her just go in and go pee! She came right back out,so I told her it's ok just go in and go to the bathroom. She came right back out, so I looked around the corner and our Bartender (Christina) was there, I asked if she could help me with Linda, she said sure! This lady (Christina) was amazing and helped Linda do her business and wash her hands afterwards! As a husband of a wife who has Alzheimer's, it is very rewarding that a young lady would help me let my wife go to the bathroom! Thank you Christina and Red Robin!!

I've in and out this place numerous times but I never used their wash room before.  Very gross, dirty slippery floor (water every where on the floor) no soup to wash my hands, how can the workers in there go washroom and wash their hands before going back to pre food for consumers. Their burgers and service are always not bad here. ( must be the patties).  Space is really nice for big groups and big families to gather and have good dinner.  A meal is around 35-40$ for hubby and I to dine here. I just couldn't stand how yucky their washroom is today so I had to write this review:( and I hope the manager would read this cuz I know we will be back to eat here and some how I might be using the washroom and I don't want to see how yucky it is.
Don't order the Mac and cheese tavern burger if you like Mac and cheese... Going to stick to the original menu items...

This is my older daughter's favorite place to eat,  since she surprised us today with a visit with my grand baby here we are. Lauren our server was excellent!!! Yes it was packed & had to wait but it was on a Saturday, thank god they had my 805.  My ultimate burger was the best... Luckily the made the wife's margaritas perfect or I would have to here it. Thank R.R.

My family and I usually go to the Red Robin's in Rancho Cucamonga, and their food is delicious. I expected the same here in Chino, but I had an upsetting experience. First my daughters Mac and cheese seemed less appetizing, and she had a tough time finishing it. She loves mac and cheese more then any other, but she didn't seem to be enjoying it after having a couple of bites. My wife noticed it was watery, and a bit discolored. I ordered the Whiskey River BQQ burger, and by the time I ate half of it I felt my stomach starting churning. I also had the buffalo wings appetizer, but my wife ate them as well and felt fine. After eating half of my burger, and finishing my fries I felt queasy. I headed to the bathroom with my 3 year old because she had said she felt sick as well, and I had thought maybe she would vomit (she didn't). I ended up vomiting almost all of food. Coming back to my table, and seeing my burger made me feel worse. The waiter came to ask if I wanted a box, and I told him that I had become sick from eating my burger; that I wasn't going to take it home with me. He simply apologized for me becoming sick, and removed my burger from the table. After taking my burger I tried settling my stomach down a bit, but once again I went to the restroom to vomit some more. Returning to my table my wife told me the waiter came back to ask if I was alright, and brought me a Ginger-Ale. The only reason I'm giving it two stars is because of my waiter. He apologized, and brought me something to ease my stomach. I am not happy that I paid full price for half a burger that made me sick. I'm not the type to make a scene, and I'm a very patient man. My waiter was nice, and I don't blame him for my food making me sick, but I just wish more could have been done. I will not be coming here again, and will not recommend this Red Robin's to my friends either. I understand that everyone's experience is different, and I wish mine was different as well.

I am not a fan of their new set up. And their new burgers added to their menu are about $5 more than their old burgers. So I just order from their old menu. AND their new sauces are additional costs too. I think they should offer one complimentary sauce per person. They also changed their garlic fries from garlic parmesan to garlic herb. Make sure you ask for the old style fries if you want them!
As usual this place is our fallback restaurant if the kids don't know what they want Red Robin's always a decent place to go

Horrible horrible horrible service. Coming from the manager, to the server, to the host. Waited one hour to get seated. Another 45 mins for fries. Another 45 mins for food. And got charged for sauce. Never again coming here

Really enjoy Red Robin. The food quality is very good, the service seems to always be good, and the location is clean. The only issue here is the parking. The shopping center is really busy, and parking can be challenging to say the least.

Who can say no to their bottom-less steak fries? I think that's why I keep coming back here. Their food is tasty and the service is friendly. Why only 3 stars though? The service can be pretty slow....I've been coming to this location for years and it's always been pretty slow. The servers are friendly, and they're always very apologetic for the bouts of waiting, but I mean..that doesn't change the fact that service is slow. If you come here when it's slow though, you might not mind as much because they really do make great burgers. The temp of my medium burger is always right with just a hint of pink, and not over-done like so many other burger joints. The steak fries are hot and burn-your-mouth delicious, so be careful and don't forget to sprinkle on their house seasoning salt (available at purchase at the front and no they don't pay me to say that). Wash it all down with their freckled lemonade or their root beer float, both bottomless! So yes, come here, but to speed things alot, make sure you know what you wanna order, and put in an order of fries as soon as the waitress will allow haha. Pay with the little touch screen on your table and you've just saved yourself like 20 minutes total wait time.

We love Red Robin but this was the last straw...  Over the last six months we have come several times and there has not been a visit where they did not screw up our order...  Whether it was over cooked burgers or the core of the lettuce in my burger...  It's always something...  This will be our last visit for a very long time, especially to this location!  Their kitchen needs to get it together, but we love the servers!!!

Terrible Service for mediocre food.  Avoid.  You have to be seated by incompetent people.  The servers do not have you table set until you tell them you need utensils or napkins.  Drink orders take forever to take and deliver.  All food is either greasy or under prepared.  The wait again is long.

Unfortunately there is no ZERO star rating here, otherwise they would have gotten it. My wife, got a coupon through her email saying she gets to have a free burger of some sort. The small print was, with the order of an entree and two drinks. Which is fine as we went together and I was going to order something for myself. But again this is Red Robin and everything on the menu is ho-hum.  So, I decided to order a large order of buffalo chicken wings. Before I placed the order, I showed our server the email coupon and she acknowledged that, she knew about it. When we finished eating and I wanted to pay the  bill, I noticed the burger was not taken off. Called our server and she said it is only valid with an entree and the large order (more expensive then most burgers on the menu) was just an appetizer.  She could have warned me about this situation before placing my order and I would happily order a burger or a salad. When I made this point she went inside to talk to the manager abut came back with the same story. Paying $6.99 for a crappy burger is not going to kill me but I will make everything in my power to kill as much business as possible for them from now on. If it is her oversight, maybe she needs to be more attentive and management should correct their employees' mistakes to prevent bad publicity.  If it is the management's decision to prevent the servers from warning people so that they can not use the coupons sent to them, it is chicken excrement and they deserve to lose business till they have to shut the place down. I was not a happy camper tonight and will not be returning to Red Robin again. I hope someone from their corporate is reading this and have  a word with them about how to handle customer requests.

Came for a light dinner before it closed. Not very many customers. Some servers definitely gave the impression that they just wanted to leave. The one we had serving us asked us for our order. With our two entrees I asked for a glass of wine.. the house cab to be exact. Waited patiently. It never came. I hoped that she didn't charge for it & it was never put on the receipt. A little disappointed with that. She then added a remark at the end with "thank you for your patience.. we just got 8 tables out of no where." We were one of the first families to have sat down an hour and a half before closing time. We had a really easy order. I've never been disappointed in a Red Robin experience, this was the first!

Great service! We went in on a Saturday afternoon for a quick lunch bite. We opted to sit in the bar area - close to the beer! Server was friendly, food was delicious, drinks were readily available. Perfect!

I just left less than 10 minutes ago and I honest to God want to throw up. Iew. The food was so greasy, our table was so sticky, the fries were all cold and the wait was forever. If you look at most of my reviews, you will see that I'm not one of those overly negative people handing out one stars left and right. I try to be as fair and understanding as possible. My family and I couldn't take it any more so we left our food, paid our bill and walked over to in n out. Ugghhh. The food though. Just gross.
This place is great for a quick night not with friends or the significant other. Good food. Decently priced. And very friendly servers every time we've been here!

This review is hard because the food here is good but we went here for my birthday. I wanted a place where the family would feel comfortable and I could take the one and two year old. My husband insisted we went somewhere else because he wanted it to be "special" but my seven year old and I thought it would be fine. My husband told two or three girls that it was my birthday and two of them said happy birthday, my husband was really upset that people around us were getting sang to while I didn't. I don't mind because I don't like that type of attention but I really don't like that my husband felt so bad he had to stop by to get me a small cake and candle just because they didn't do it at this place. He really tried telling the employees and it was cute but it was really sad seeing how disappointment he was with this whole experience.

Went during the Happy Hour Specials. The service was great and the Mushroom Burger was so intense. I love all the sauteed mushrooms they flood the burger with and when you ask for a medium cooked patty, it's perfect.

Today is friday. friday is no meat day. so i decided to order fish and the end result was sad. just sad. the fish was a bit soggy and the fries looked like they weren't even cooked. the fires were the worst part. just please make sure the fries are cooked all the way a golden yellow. and the fish doesn't sit for long periods of time.

My wife came home from a lunch,  and mentioned she had a fly in her cheese.  Although a fly in her food, the manager Anthony was on point.  He assured her of her bill was taken care of and gave her a gift card.  My wife understands things happen and was taken by how nice they treated her even with a complaint.  In the end we will continue to go there,  as the management and company seems to have their customers interests in high regards.  Thank you again manager Anthony for taking care of it.

Came in for a 2-for-1 burger special. The food was good as usual, but I am very unhappy how rushed and also ignored my wife and I felt.  Our waitress was quite impatient while we ordered, then was nowhere to be found until it came time to pay when she again became impatient.  It was not busy so no need to rush us, and we were never asked if we wanted anything else. Not the best experience

Came in here on a Saturday night with the hubby. I was expecting at least a 30 min wait but that was for dining. There was a few immediate seatings at the bar so we chose that. Our server, Ashley was prompt and friendly. She took our orders for drinks and appetizers. We ordered the Ultimate Grilled Cheese and even Ashley commented that it's really good. When the grilled cheese arrived, we noticed that all the cheese inside wasn't melted. It was just a stack of different cheeses. We thought, maybe that's how they do their grilled cheese. We pointed it out to Ashley when she came around to check in on us. She said it wasn't suppose to be like that. She apologized and offered to have another 1 done for us. We said it's not necessary. Still, she insisted on having the manager come see us. Daniel came by and confirmed that the grilled cheese isn't suppose to be like that. He apologized and had another 1 done for us. Well they were right. This Ultimate Grilled Cheese was certainly yummy (now that it was done right) This would have been a 2 star review for this place, if not for Ashley and Daniel. Thanks for making it a great evening guys! Keep up the good work and awesome customer service.

Red Robin recently tried to recreate itself in chino hills. Fewer tables and fewer staff, results in even slower service. Bottomless fries...you actually have to get fries brought to your table. Really disappointed. See how big the side salad is now. Save time and energy. Go somewhere else.

We haven't been to this location in about a year. Their new remodel was very nicely done and it makes the place look very inviting. The waiting area is still roomy and has plenty of places to sit and the hostess was extremely friendly. Our server did an  excellent job introducing many of the new menu items. While this is our first time back to this location in about a year we have been to the red robins over the last few months. And what I find funny is they have decrease the size of the plates made them heavier so the portions are smaller.  The sallet dishes or bowls are extremely shallow. They change the old garlic fries now they have more herbs on them and seasoning. I was a bigger fan of the old ones. This time I had a chicken bruschetta sandwich and garlic fries both tasted great I would've preferred the old fries though. Wife had a chicken club type salad. There was hardly any letters yet what she did receive tasted great. Love the look of the new location, service was terrific, the food is still good. I do feel sorry for the wait staff carrying around those heavy plates

I am a regular at this Red Robin.  I have also been at several across the country.  This is one most inconsistently managed.  The servers are great but there is always a 20+ minute wait for an table when the restaurant has numerous empty tables.  My estimate that there was only 60% to 70% of the tables used.  What are you waiting for the President???   So that tells me they do not bother to staff correctly.  I had hoped this would have changed a year ago when it came under new management but that just is not the case.    My wife and I choose the bar so the families with kids can have all the space they need.I really can't believe I have to put my name in to sit in the bar, when there are empty tables. This just kills the customer experience.    I hope this get their attention. I think corporate should really review, audit and if they have too take this restaurant over.  Regretfully there is no e-mail address to send them this complaint.  So you all get to see it.

I got my order to go. A turkey burger lettuce wrapped with sweet potato fries. I thought I was gonna have to wait a while because it was a Sunday afternoon. I waited less than 15min and my food was delicious :) Now I'm not hungry anymore and I'm happy! Would come back would recommend!

My wife and I went in because we were given a Gift Card.  Thank you Robert and Gina for turning us on to this wonderful place.  We were greeted nicely by the staff and told we could sit wherever we wanted.  We picked the bar area and were quite comfortable. Our orders were taken right away and served  in time.  appetizers first,  soup and salad then main orders. Wife had Nacho Crunch Tavern Dble and orderd the Tortilla soup.  Was the best Tortilla soup I've ever had as i'm not that much of a fan until I had it here.  I had the All American Patty Melt.  It was delicious and so was the beer. 5 stars and we will be back .  thank you for a wonderful dining experience! Edd and Diane Bean
Went here for lunch today. Always great service. Love the fries! The food is amazing as well.  We were seated right away. And there's a variety to choose from.

Came in with my mom and got burger and chicken also got drinks.  I found a long piece i mean a long peice of hair in my drink disgusting never coming  back .the manger gave us a free dessert but i can't wat it eh.

I'd give them more stars but lately they've been quite mediocre. My family and I frequent this location because our three boys under the age of 11 enjoy eating here and it's loud enough so they don't have to be so quiet. While most of the staff is friendly and nice there are times when it's not the best service. Like yesterday afternoon. When we sat down we ordered drinks they came out fairly quickly. But then we said we needed a minute to order and then the waitress didn't come back for a very long time. When she did return to take our order our order came out also fairly quickly. However my son's meal was supposed to be 9 pieces it was only 6. She bought the extra 3 pieces in a small cup. My fries and my mother in laws fries were cold. my husband got a Whiskey River wrap that was a quarter of the size it usually is and had no lettuce in it or very little I should say. When we showed it to our waitress who corrected my husband and told him there's lettuce there's just very little she took it to the back and the chef just shoved lettuce in the front of it. I wish I would have took a picture because it was a damn shame red robin is much better than they performed yesterday. Across from us we noticed another Booth calling our waitress over which they pulled a very long hair from their food. The manager did visit their table not sure what was said because you could not hear. As I walk out by the kitchen we could see a few people working back there. One was the young lady with very ratty hair coming out of the back of her hat. I think she needed to have a hairnet at the least. Disappointed in our experience because usually it's a decent dining experience.

Stopped in here with some relatives for a bite. Large parking lot so no problems there. There was a waiting line but it went quick. Our server was quite attentive and checked with us several times so that was good. We discussed the bottomless french fries offer...we basically don't like the large american cut fries and prefer the skinny fries...to each their own. We all ordered salads instead of the french fries. What I didn't know, was that you could basically have bottomless orders of the salad since we opted for it instead. I got the bacon cheeseburger. It was cooked exactly like I ordered it...well done. Everyone seemed pleased with their meals. I added a tall beer tonight. Now it was louder than average in here and there were a couple small children crying but that's kids. So basically, everything was good. But for me, there was nothing special or over the top here...just average, so for me, just 3 stars.

Came here on a late Wednesday and had a short wait till we were seated. Our server was amazing and I loved that she kept checking on us. The prices are ok for the food but came out pretty quick. Love that you can order from the tablet on the table and lay quickly.

It's a great place for a group to eat together. I usually come here catching up with friends.  Their strawberry lemonade is delicious and it's bottomless. Their steakfries are yummy plus you can add the seasoning salt to your liking.  The staff can be a hit or miss when I was there. Sometime they're attentive or sometimes they forget to give us refills.

I am really grateful that Red Robin does gluten free burgers and fries but this is the second time that I have gone to this location and received regular fries instead of ones without seasoning. The first time was fine since I was in the restaurant and was able to have them replaced, this time I got take away and i was out fries with my burger since they gave me regular. Thankful I noticed the seasoning and didn't eat them. So just a heads up to anyone with a gluten allergy make sure you pay attention here just in case they don't.

I went for lunch today . The entire order took a very long time and one of the basic items Sweet potato fries took forever . I was told by my server that manager will get it as they are taking really long time to make it .. But finally server got it . My wife order simple glass of water which never came in . The fries where over cooked with lot of oil . It was very bad lunch option
The hamburgers were okay. The service was a little slow. And the final tab I felt was not worth it.

First, let me start with, we have been regular RR customers for over 10 years.  Lately, I'd say over the last 2 years, each visit, we have taken notice of change that we have not welcomed.  From cheaper kid treats, to less fries, and higher prices, we're done.  Our latest visit has unfortunately, been our last.  Our family has officially put RR in our past as a place we once frequented.  The service is no longer good, the prices are outrageous, the kids menu/entertainment now consists of a black and white piece of paper and see my picture of the fry basket we received.......ridiculous, bye bye RR.
Food was good but atmosphere has changed  They have redecorated ..... They removed all the whimsical pictures from the walls and replaced with nothing original. ....lost character :0 (

It is always a great time whenever I am here. The service is always awesome and friendly. The burgers are also great. I usually order the bacon cheeseburger, if not the Royal burger. Both are usually done well, especially since I like my meats rare, and I expect Americans to see "rare" as a European medium. The fries are also good, so that is no problem. I did feel a bit disappointed with the fried clams I ordered, they were not very appealing and I probably should have ordered a burger at that time instead. Regarding drinks, I had the skinny margarita, which tasted like a watered-down margarita, but not all that bad (which is probably why they call it skinny). I also tried the vojito, which was actually pretty tasty. Also, if it is your birthday, you get a free dessert. (:
Great service and food. Had the Robins finest burger with a side of guaca and the good ol' 805 draft

I usually love red robins. Today wasn't a good day for me or something. My bc and I sat at the bar side. I got a beer, drank an inch until I looked at the glass and there were multiple LIPSTICK STAINS all over. I was discussed because who knows if the lady had a disease or is sick. I told the server and she got me a new beer. I pretty much lost my appetite and didn't want the beer anymore but I drank about the same amount and noticed ANOTHER LIPSTICK STAIN. But it was only one and located on the right side so I didn't drink from the same spot. I didn't want to complain again so I left it. Also my fries were cold so that was a let down. The burger was good as always. DIDN'T get anything taken off the bill or anything.

My boyfriend and I went had the worst customer service ever!  The first server was Jennifer she was ok. But they switched servers on us. I didn't even get her name . She disappear on us . . We were waiting for our food.  She made weird face expressions I didn't really care for our servers . Basically they need to work on. Customer service.  The restroom were very dirty.. The only thing was good was the food.  We will not come back.

Gluten free buns and dedicated fryers!!! So I haven't eaten at a Red Robin in about 4 years, at least. I've had celiacs and let's face it when you can't have the frys it's not worth the trouble.   Well  with this location ( not all are like this),  they have udi'a gluten free buns and a dedicated fryer for the frys!!! Yes!!!!! So I had a turkey burger and frys.  Now what made me sad was that their BBQ sauce has wheat in it?   Come on red robin 90% of BBQ sauces  don't need this additive!!!! No gf BBQ and their turkey was just ok. - 1 star Service was on point and great.
The food is sometimes slow, on top of that the plates, silverware and cups all have water spots

Super disappointing . I never eat at Red Robin and tonight reminded me why. The food took forrevveerr! They kept offering us fries. I think we ended up with 5 unfinished baskets. My friend ended up canceling his order. They offered to refund him, as if that was a kindness in their part. You would expect a national chain to have a better system for getting food out in a timely manner. Save your time and money and go to any number of good restaurants in Chino Hills. The waitress was way too comfortable with us as well. We would rather our servers do a better job at remembering what we asked for and spend less time talking about "getting drunk" on their beer. Sad, sad, sad. I won't be back again until I forget why I don't eat here...

Slow slow service. Burnt bread with soup. Soup was Luke warm. Not worth coming here. The place was packed but it looked like there was not enough waiters. It took 40 minutes for two bowls of soups, cluck and fries, and a kids burger. All for 40 bucks waste of my money ugh! -spoke with manager Juan- seemed helpful and said he would follow up. Like Red Robin so hopefully it gets better.

Red Robin has a great variety of food for just about any appetite. They are usually busy on the weekends so be prepared to wait. The staff is friendly and attentive. They offer pick up and if your working and too tired to cook this is a great option.

My wife and I went here for lunch on a Saturday.  Place was so dis-organized.  Not sure if we will go back there. Only saw our server twice.  Once after we had to ask another server who tried to deliver someone else's salads to our table.  And again when she brought the bill.  When she brought the bill she said "I know this is early" we had not even finished the meal.  She spent all her time at a couple of tables with larger groups of people.  It was obvious she was working the "tips" and not providing service to just a couple.  When they delivered the meal we had no silverware or napkins.  Other server said she would bring them but never returned.  Had to ask front hostess setting table for silverware after waiting about ten minutes. Then had to ask a passing server for more fries.  We have eaten there before and never had such bad service but it has been awhile since we have eaten there.
Great food  fast service will be back laurel was an awesome waitress who made sure if we needed anything she got it fast

Damn so packed for an overrated over price burger. Ashlee is our servicer and makes eye contact without asking if we need anything. How hard is it to bring out some steak fries to help our hunger. I won't be coming here in a long time.
Thank you Red Robin! Stopped by for my "Birthday Burger" at your location. Great service & my burger was delicious!!

Red Robin sells hamburgers and other things that should be sold at a place such as this.  The hamburgers are pretty tasty and fries do not stop.  We have had the opportunity to sit in the bar area on few occasions, and we have been waited on by Adrian.  This waiter is awesome.  The food is good, but the service is better.

Love love love their burgers! The quality is superb and you can definitely tell the difference between them and other burger places. They have a variety of burgers and other food as well and the atmosphere is nice. They're expensive but worth the price!
Friendly staff! Best dog friendly place in town. They always open the patio up for us and turn on the heat lamps when its chilly.

Corporate Customer service Cares. Not long after posting my review I receive a request from Red Robins corporate head quarters notifying me someone would be in contact with me to follow up on our poor dining experience. I received a call the next day however I did not answer since the number was unfamiliar to me. They left a message wanting to follow up and even left a number to contact them again. I never called the next day they called I finally answered the manager apologized for our experience asked for a few details on what they could do to improve next time and said she would send us a gift card to try them again. I was quite impressed with the trouble they went through to resolve my poor dining experience. Sometimes you complain about a meal and feel no one really cares well heres one for the books Red Robin Cares.
Wait time is too long, the prices are ridiculous.  Onion rings can cost up to 10 bucks for a tower of twelve.  If you want veggie patty substitution it is extra as well as gluten free bun.

It's about 9 of us and I guess because we r a big group it took about 45 min to get seated. and we have been waiting for over and hour and a half for our food they are being nice about it and bringing fries i know it's not their fault but this is taking forever maybe they need to hire more people on the weekends just saying.
The burgers are really good.  I think it is much better than habits or the like.  I like the thick fries as the middle part is softer than most normal fries.  Will try the garlic fries next time!

I usually don't do negative reviews, but.. The manager that worked tonight is a dick. Bro.. Act professional, not like you're on your period. Say hello, smile... Other than that, my server was awesome and their a1 peppercorn burger is good.

Started to come here more often because the kids love it. They have balloons and crayons to keep the kids entertained. The kids menu had burgers, chicken fingers, Mac and cheese and other kid favorites.  I am a big fan of their burgers and fries. I have tried several items on the menu and have not been disappointed yet.
Friendly servers and always smiling. Great for family and friends. Fast service. Love it!! Definitely will.come back due to great customer service.

This Red Robin is by far my most liked location. Let me tell you why.  BOTTOMLESS is the most talked word at Red Robin's, so it will also be so in my review. If you never been to a Red Robin, your fries are BOTTOMLESS, meaning you can get as much fries as you want with your order. On top of that, so are their drinks, even the specialty drinks like their famous Freckled Lemonade (strawberry lemonade with strawberry slices). So, drink up that lemonade because it's BOTTOMLESS.  My top 3 burgers from here (in order) are:  1) Guacamole Bacon Burger. I love guacamole in a burger! Need i really to say more? 2) Whiskey River BBQ Burger. I don't normally like barbecue sauce, but in this burger, I'll take it.  3) Sauteed 'Shroom Burger. It's all about them mushrooms. I like mushrooms. And so does my boyfriend. Therefore, I like mushrooms more.   For you couples, best friends forever, or not-much-of-an-eater, you can ask your server to have the burger split in half. My boyfriend and I usually request this because these burgers are BIG and with BOTTOMLESS fries, half does the job. One of the things I didn't know until a year or so after of coming here often is that you can substitute your fries with other sides. Salads, coleslaw, and steamed broccoli is free of charge. Other items such as their mac n cheese costs additional. But regardless, whichever side you get, it is also BOTTOMLESS.  But why this location? See, whenever I come here, my whole party will get a Freckled Lemonade and they'll only charge me for one because the rest, our server considers as BOTTOMLESS refills. You can bet I tip my server well! In addition, our server always brings out baskets of fries while we're waiting for our burgers. Now that's some service.  Huge parking lot and lots of stores in the same plaza. Right off the freeway, too.  RED ROBINNNNN!!

Went here with my wife after having a disappointing experience at the Red Robin in Orange, CA. We came during Homecoming time as the there were a lot of kids all dressed up, which lead to a wait. Well this particular Red's waitress, Ashley, rose to the occasion and delivered EXCELLENT service. She had her hands full but managed to continually get me refills of my freckled lemonade and some of those tasty unlimited french fries. Hats off to this establishment and the GM as we have come back since then and again we pleased with our visit. As always the food is great, this Red Robin may have won us back!!

Came in for lunch because my 3 year old niece is in love with their freckled lemonade aka strawberries in your lemonade big chucks of them.  Anyway came in for lunch got the California grilled chicken with the bottomless fries and my mom got a short stack of onion rings still enough to share.  I don't like onions so I don't like onion rings but these where really good!  We got a basket of fries to start waitress was really really nice she noticed my mom feeding those yummy strawberries to my niece and she brought her 2 free sides of them!  The food overall good for burgers service great onion rings amazing and freckled lemonade a must! Only thing that I can complain about was their decor used to be cool and different  newly remodeled just lost the Red Robin touch.  Will be back for the yummy food.

I think this location must have a new manager because it used to be a solid five star Red Robin but now it is horrible. My wife and I went in around 7 pm on Saturday and as usual went straight to the bar to find open seating. There were only three other tables occupied so we decided to sit in one of the half-booths next to the bar. There was still plates and cups on the table from previous customers but it has never been a problem before. We sat there for five minutes and watched six different people walk by us at least five times each and no one even acknowledged our presence. After a few more minutes of this we decided to attempt to just get a table in the regular dining area. We put our name in with the Jessica the hostess and sat down. We watched as three groups come in after we put our name in, two of them also parties of two, and were seated before us. I went up to the hostess and asked if there was a problem with me or my wife and explained what had happened. She said there was no problem and said she could seat us right away. I wanted to leave but my wife was really hungry so we stayed. Our server was actually really nice and the food was good but I doubt I will ever go there again. They made us feel like we didn't exist.

Came here for dinner and the wait was about 30 minutes . We got the best server who was polite , friendly and smiling. Ordered their fish burger and veggie burger. Also their tower of onion rings. The Veggie burger was the most tasty . Their fries come with a endless refills. You can keep asking for more. Loved and enjoyed this restaurant.
False wait. Came in for lunch because my child wanted to. I can see a few dozen open tables but there is a 15-20 minute wait for a party of 2?!?!? Poorly ran, and staffed. Thumbs down. Zero stars.
Vanessa was an extremely attentive and pleasant waitress. We never had to ask for anything. She just knew to bring it out to us already. Good job Red Robin! :)

Came here tonight with my sister. We had just finished watching a movie. We got here about 15min before closing. We were greeted in about 2min by our server, Sunshine. She got us waters right away. Then gave us ample time to look over the menu. In my opinion too much time but hey each server has their own flow. We ordered bbq wings and a bbq burger. The wings were better than I expected and the burger was actually amazing. The bbq sauce was really good. I was so excited to give this place 5 stars then our server did not check how the food was until we were done and the fries were not cooked to the doneness I would prefer. So all and all this was a great experience it missed 5 stars by a hair.

My experience was not bad overall. My dad got a drink spilled on him and they gave us free appetizers. Our first waiter just seemed like he was on overload, he kind of came off as being rude and my family did not like it at all. I am more understanding to the fact that everyone has bad days and you never know what may be going on in a persons life. We then got a great waiter named Cameron. He seemed like a very nice guy, very attentive, very personable and provided overall excellent service. I really hope that management gives Cameron a raise, he sure does deserve it. He was a fabulous waiter and I hope he gets rewarded for it.

Love this location. The staff is super friendly and on top of things. They bring out fries to start while you're waiting for your food. Poppy seed honey mustard is addicting, if you haven't tried it it's a must! You can also bring your dog to the patio while you eat. We have a small dog, not sure if it matters for bigger dogs. They bring out water for them too.

I wish their food were as good as their  drinks and shakes. The strawberry lemonade and mint brownie shake are YUMMY SCRUMBOES and are two things I will always get everytime.  Service: I came here on a Wednesday night and it was unbelievably busy! Not only was about every table filled, but when I was leaving at around 8pm, a huge party was coming in. However, I would have to give service a 4/5 because our waitress was incredibly nice under all that pressure. She was one of those people who knows what to do on nights like these. Instead of bringing out one refill of lemonade at a time, she would bring out two to stay ahead of herself and to keep her customers happy. I do need to knock off a star though because the food came out so slow. Yes, they were busy, but I've seen busier and nicer restaurants work faster in the kitchen. No excuse.  Food: meh. I'm never impressed with their food. Their burgers are thoughtfully made, but maybe I'm just impartial to greasy American food. Though I do enjoy their burger with the egg in it. So good! During this visit, I opted for the Red White and Bleu salad. Yup. Definitely not impressed. The salad was a regular mix of iceberg lettuce, shredded carrots and cabbage with honey mustard dressing, candied walnuts and Bleu cheese, and a chicken breast that did not seem natural. I could've gone to the store and bought the same ingredients and still have made it better.  Overall: I'm glad they changed the look of their menu because the old one was out dated. The restaurant is decorated just like any other red robin, and everything seems to be in order. I just wish their food was better !

Horrible service. After calling in to place an order for pickup, I was put on hold for ten minutes. I had to call back to place my order. When I finally got my order, there was a big ball of hair combined with a string, of what looked to be from a rag, grilled onto one of the fries. Disgusting. Never eating there again.
Just ok. Services are overly friendly, but service is super super slow. 10 minutes to get your drinks, and about 40 for food. this wasn't the first time. Make sure you have all day if you come here.

Took my Mom for her Bday. Waitress was ok, but didn't notice we didn't have silverware or napkins & neither did the person who brought the food. After waiting several minutes without anyone noticing I was looking for help, I dove into my burger. It was great, but messy. After 3-4 bites, with sauce dripping down my face & hands, I wanted to see if anyone would notice. A manager, later identified as Daniel, looked my way & made eye contact. I was expecting him to ask if everything was ok, but he didn't so I asked him for some napkins. He brought 3. For both of us & I clearly needed more than that for myself so I asked for more. One would think Daniel would follow up with us to make sure we had everything we needed but, nope. He never did. This was the 2nd bad service there in as many weeks. Guess I'll stick with Islands or Applebee's across the street...

So this was my first time here and I came here on a Sunday with my family. I waited about 30 minutes before we were seated and waited about another 15 before we ordered our drinks and appetizer.  It then took another 10 minutes for our drinks to come and for the waiter to take our orders. Waited about another 30 minutes for our food to come and by that time I just didn't want to wait anymore. The food was just mediocre and I didn't find anything special about it. I finished my fries and thr waiter did not bother to ask me if I wanted more. I know ot was my first time there, but I do know about the bottomless fries. Whatever... I did enjoy the Freckled Lemonade which was amazing. I got at least 3 refills.  I will try Red Robbins again and hopefully, the wait and service will be better.

I do not eat at red robin often, but have been only to this location. We say in a booth in the bar. Service was hit and miss. It was not busy. Drinks were slow getting refilled, never did get fries refilled, even though it was offered and accepted. The menus are bad here, we had four menus, all of which had the actual menu instead in different locations throughout the book. Kinda petty I know. But also two of them had mysterious sticky substances on them. It just makes you feeling dirty after touching them. Please have someone clean them. Overall the food was good though, just could not wait to put some hand sanitizer on my hands after eating though.

This place is just alright. Their biggest selling point is the bottomless fries and that's about it. Burgers are just okay, nothing special. Came on a Sunday afternoon with a few friends, wait time was about 30 minutes. I ordered the Chili Chili Cheeseburger which lacked flavor and the chili just didn't taste very good. Service was solid despite the food taking almost an hour to come out. Will I come back? Probably will come here once or twice a year but Red Robin is never a place that gets my attention. Beer selection at this location sucks as well.

I posted a previously negative review after a string of poor visits following their recent renovation. I am tickled to report that I was heard -- they have made changes to improve the process to the original friendly enjoyable place it was pre-renovation and I even got a response to my post. The food has always been fantastic but it was wonderful to see they cared and have taken steps to make changes in how people are treated at their restaurant. A+ RR! Well done!

The wait staff and hostess went above and beyond to make sure our visit was a great one! I haven't experienced top notch customer service that great in a long time. From chatting politely as she walked us to our table to offering an additional bag for our take home food, the hostess was amazing! The waitress was very accommodating to my mother in law's requests for item substitutions and fresh, hot coffee. Well done Chino!!
Everything I've tried has been good enough. Chicken sandwich. Jalapeno onion straws are yummy. I'm not into burgers or fries so just "A-OK" for me.
We are currently at this Red Robin and for the second time in 3 months we have to wait a really long time for our food. And we have a toddler with us. Not good.

My husband & I have been going here for years & have always been happy with it. For some reason, not sure why, but we hadn't been there in about 6 months. In that time, they have changed it completely & not for the better. It is all new people & the menu has changed. I ordered the Cobb salad. They had no eggs, lettuce was old, no olives & it was half the size it use to be for the same price. Even thou our waiter Josh was great, we will not be coming back for a long time.

I recently put a to go order at this location, I waited 10 minutes on hold to place the order, I arrived to pick up on time which I found that the missed multiple crucial details on my order (meat instead of boca). They did not apologize and acted as if I made the mistake on the phone, they made me wait another 20 minutes and without apology or possibly a discount for doing the order incorrectly. I proceed to get home and found that the order was still incorrect (garden burger instead of boca). I would be understanding of the staff was accommodating, but they appeared to have their minds elsewhere including the staff on the phone, on my receipt it shows that the servers name is Courtney. I have never had an issue before at this location.

Best Red Robin I have been to when it comes to the food. I ordered a burger and it wasn't greasy at all which was surprising. Minus two stars because their technique is to avoid your table and your request for more fries until you've eaten everything and are full. It's so obvious they're trying to cut costs that way.

Sad.. The decor has changed and even more sad So has their food. The tender chicken salad has literally been cut in half by portion yet same price and NO GARLIC BREAD .. Not to mention I had to ask for it though it comes with the salad. The service was extra slow .. We had our food but not enough utensils. Lame

Food was semi cold when we got it. Server (Kerry) forgot about us for a while not busy at all. No refills until the end of our meal. Didn't ask if we were royalty members which we are had to tell her after we paid and then she had to change all the checks again. Decent food needs better service

Not bad. Went for lunch on a weekday, was seated instantly. I had a "Whisky River Burger" (large patty, cheese, bbq sauce, crispy fried onions, lettuce tomato) and my sister had some sort of double kid's burger. Food took an average time to come out. Initially it was a pretty small portion of steak fries, but the server came after awhile and asked if we wanted refills, which were a lot better. She never asked if we wanted a second refill. Had to ask for water refills, too. Burger itself was good. She asked if we wanted "some pink", and we did, but it was cooked through. Crispy fried onions underneath the burger were great. It was our first time, we'll probably go again.

I've dined at this Red Robin location several times in the past and even just had dinner here with a friend about three hours ago. My experiences dining at this location has been pretty a-okay. Parking can be a bit difficult to find during the weekends, because there is also an all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ restaurant that shares the same parking lot. The wait time can extend to about 20-30 minutes long during the weekends, but the host/hostess has been courteous and polite upon the arrival of customers. The interior of the restaurant is colorful, decorative, and clean. Make sure to watch your step when entering to sit in and exiting from the booths because there is a step. The servers are friendly and come by frequently to ask if you need anything else. Their beef patties are cooked however you would like them to be cooked. I highly suggest trying their D.G.B. burger, which may or may not be a limited-timed menu item. I am not so sure. But, it is so delicious and full of flavor that you will not be disappointed! After dining, the server will ask you if you prefer to pay the bill by cash or card and there is even a convenient tablet on the table that will allow you to quickly pay the bill by card. Overall, the food is tasty but the prices are a bit up there in my opinion. However, on a positive note, this restaurant is a great place to grab a drink, watch sports, or catch up with friends. I'll occasionally return back again.

When you walk in you should be greeted with a smile. We were greeted with with a a frown. The hostess is the first face you see when you walk in to have your lunch or dinner help sets the tone you don't want to see someone upset or frowning when you go to enjoy your meal. Not one of my best experience here tonight.
Higher prices and smaller food . Won't be coming here anymore . Everything has changed .. What a joke

I wanted to give this place another chance. My wife and I were in the mood for good burgers. I was disappointed again. My bacon cheese burger  with bleu cheese was not very good. The bleu cheese tasted like it was old and bitter. The service was also very poor.  Go elsewhere for a good burger.    I

Even though I stated that I wouldn't be back, I gave this place another shot. I ordered the same items as before, fish and chips and soup. My server was very attentive and the food came out quickly even though it was busy for dinner.

I stopped going to red robin because I felt the quality of the food over the years has changed and not like it used to be. I've been craving french onion soup, since it's cold outside and decided to give red robin another try. I ordered two bowls of French onion soup, both had no broth and were full of French bread and cheese and the soup was cold. Not much of a soup at all. I also ordered the whiskey burger which was okay but was cold and so were all our fries and other items I had purchased for the family. Big bummer since red robin is close by but unfortunately I will not be back or at least to this location.
This is my favorite spot to get some good food and great customer service. I love the service and how they connect with the customers. The food is great especially the bottomless fries
Always great burgers and fries!  Service is also good. No complaints here. I love the bottomless fries.
FAVORITE place to go eat. Food is delicious, and prices are reasonable. Fries and honey mustard and freckled lemonade is always my go to. The wraps are amazing also!!

I've been to this location several times and lately my experiences have been going downhill. A couple of years ago, I would come with a group of friends at any time and be seated in no longer than ten minutes. It seems like business has picked up since then or maybe everybody craves a Red Robin burger the same time as I do. It just always seems so busy. I came in this evening to have dinner with my family. The wait wasn't too long. Our server came to take our drink order right away, but never introduced herself. After a few minutes we got our drinks, then we placed our orders.
