Our server mike was very prompt, efficient, patient and friendly with our party of 8. We will be coming back. Great service.
This is a fun place to just go eat with friends food is inexpensive and good service is also ok

Good burgers for the most part across the board. Royal Red Robin Burger in my opinion is their flag ship burger,come on, FRIED EGG!!! enough said. i've dabbed a little bit into their sammys and they aint bad, not the best tho. service is either hit or miss, my last visit our server was great. came to check on us every 5 mins and had plenty of refills on drinks/fries  every single time. not a big fan of steak fries, but again i'm there for the burgers.

When I'm in the mood to stuff myself silly with an awesome burger, Red Robin is where I go. I LOVE the Whiskey River BBQ burger. Whether I get the hamburger or the chicken breast version, I am never disappointed. It's a symphony of messy goodness: breaded onion "shoe strings," the cheddar cheese, the rich BBQ sauce, and the slab of meat piled between two sesame seed buns. Fantabulous.  Now, I'm not usually a fan of steak fries, but RR does 'em right, and you get free fry refills (not that many people have room for more after devouring their ginormous burgers).  When I'm feeling like watching my weight, there also lots of items that can be tailored to bring down the calorie count. Ditching the cheese & getting condiments on the side will save you tons... one of my lower-cal favs here is the BLT. (But who are we kidding... I'm usually not watching my weight when I come here). :)

We went for lunch on a Sat @1:20. It was pretty busy but we didn't wait long; just over 5 min. Everyone was very friendly; hostesses and servers. Everyone was having a good time. Drinks were ordered and came immediately. Refills came without asking. The food took a little longer but my burger was very good; Red's Tavern Double. It was juicy and cooked just right! It was a great lunch!

I love this place!  The service is always quick and friendly, food also comes out quick and always tastes great!  Plus what's not to love about bottomless fries?  My husband and I come here all the time and we always order 1 burger, they are so big we don't need to get our own, get it cut in half in our own baskets with fries, I love how they are not cheap with the fries, and that they don't mind if you only order 1 burger, both people still get as many fries as they like.  The red robin royalty card is a must, it's so easy to rack up burgers and you end up getting the 10th one free, only one burger counts though per visit, but I still think its good value.

Great Burger, Bottomless Steak Fires, Awesome Atmosphere - That's Red Robin for you... This is yet another place me and my friends (more like brothers from another mother) go to have quality  "Dude" time. Plus my mom loves bottomless fries and ranch dressing. Burgers, they never fail to satisfy me. If you want mouth fulls of burger, I suggest the Monster Burger- 2 huge patties, cheese, veggie fix-ins... hold the sweet relish spread or have it on the side. That hits the spot, but so does an In-and-Out 4x4. :P The Crispy Chicken Burger and the Crispy Fish Burger (Easter time fish-only situations?) are also great if you aren't in the the beef mood. For the semi-messy, the Red Rpbin Chili cheeseburger is nice- open faced and eat it with a fork and knife (kamayan style not recommended). Great customer service! Cute waitresses! :P

Food was ok, only ate half of my burger. The "bottomless fries" came in with 7-8 fries per tray, no joke count them. Got here and there were about 3 other tables filled, not too many people. However, that didn't matter service was bad. She was nice at first but not attentive. Ordered no tomatoes, got tomatoes. Fine no big deal I'll take them out. My friend ordered her drink, never got hers. 10 min later we Asked another waiter for it, he never brought it! Another 10 min When the original waitress came back we had to ask again. Really? At this point we were all annoyed. And waitress even said  "you are all looking kinda um.." .. Yes? Please finish, what were you saying!?  Upset? Why yes we were upset, it took 20 mins to get a drink! We did tip her though, $3. Purposely those measly 3 bucks were an insult, and I hope she understands that.

Wtf happend to bottomless fries?we had a server (brown hair,chubby) forgot her name cause she wasnt great..tonight 3/4/14.she never got us more fries even after i asked!?whaaat like shouldnt she ask us if we want more.then i was happy she didnt so i didnt seem fat haha..she didnt really care about our table as a whole..just another fake women who just wants tips which she didnt work hard enough for.i didnt pay the bill so i dont kno what tip my friends left,but if i left a tip it wouldn't have been a nice one..im usually one to leave at least 15%.also the portions are veryyy small for what your paying.i got the whiskey bbq wrap it was good but small maybe thats why they offer bottomless carbs that we never got..

I RARELY write any reviews but i had to write one this time. I was dining here with my family after work and was not prepared for the terrible service I received. To start off we had a waitress named Michelle P. ...it was a long wait to get seated to begin with and an even longer wait to place an order. Upon ordering she kept trying to sell us on different menu items than what we already wanted which was annoying enough. I ordered a Whisky BBQ wrap to share with my other sibling. The appetizer also took forever to come out.  Anyway, once we received our food, I noticed our wrap was gross...It was completely DRENCHED in BBQ sauce....had NO lettuce in it which it was supposed to have, and no ranch...It was disgusting and barely inedible as it was soaking wet in BBQ sauce...I managed to flag down our waitress after she ignored us for a good 20 minutes after our food came, along with forgetting my other siblings ranch sauce which we ordered in the beginning. I flagged the waitress down and explained to her in a nice way that there was no lettuce and way too much sauce in the wrap, she gave me a rude look and took half of the wrap away and told us she had to "show them" .....okay ? even if u had to show them we weren't eating them, and for the money you pay to eat out I just wanted it re made right? Our waitress disappeared after that and scoffed off with an attitude. more time went by and a nicer waitress who wasnt the original one we had brought out our food. Our waitress Michelle P , never bothered to 1. apologize 2. never asked if everything was better 3. never asked us for refills or anything. I was particularly bothered because I work in customer service and I was offended at her rudeness and would never treat a customer that way ever no matter what. She finally came by 20 more min later to ask if it was right, then quickly sped off before I could get a word in and asked her for a side of ranch....she rushed an said "yeah" and walked off with an attitude again. 10 minutes later she returned "THROWING THE RANCH AT ME ON THE TABLE QUICKLY" and walked away with the attitude never asking or saying to me but actually tossing it at me on the table, my family and I looked at each other and wondered how anyone could be that rude....I was so upset....We soon received the bill only to realize that she once again messed up our bill and overcharged us....(probably on purpose) , we waited another 20 minutes later because their manager had to correct it, Again the waitress was RUDE telling us we only have 4 points now on our rewards, and threw the bill on the table not even apologizing. I have NEVER experienced customer service this bad in my entire life, No one told her to work there. I feel bad for whoever else has her as a waitress. I don't think I will be returning to this location. I would've talked to a manager if everything hadn't already taken 2 hours but I was tired and wanted to leave. It was terrible. It was so bad that the people next to us were complaining  to the manager about how their Shrimp was hard as a rock! Get your act together Red Robin! there are plenty of other places around you that have better customer service. I was nice enough to leave a few bucks as a tip but even then it wasnt even worth a dollar. Never Again.

In high school, I used to be able to eat a burger and the side of fries, and probably 3-4 more baskets of fries WITH a freckled lemonade. I was such a beast! I wish I could eat that much now T_T I obviously love the fries and love dipping them in various sauces. You HAVE to try the poppy seed honey mustard dressing. I also like to order ranch and add ketchup and a few dashes of that Red Robin seasoning. Have you ever looked at the sodium content? It's out of control but it's so good.  I usually get the 5 alarm burger or the mushroom burger, but this time I ordered blackened bayou burger. It was decent. It has coleslaw, caramelized onions, roasted red peppers, and a chipotle aioli. It sounds better than it actually tasted.

I've never been to a red robins ever so this was my first experience. Spent $34 on 3 people. 3 burgers and bottomless fries for all three which is always included with every burger which was awesome. Food tasted great. Ordered a bbq chicken burger with fried onion strings and lettuce and it was amazing. Waiters and waitresses were nice. Overall, great place to eat. As soon as i ran out of fries, another batch came in and if they stopped, all i did was ask and i got another batch around 5 minutes later.

my 9yr old and I love this place, especially my son, he loves how he can put his own seasoning salt mix on his French fries, he gets a kick out of it, food is always great, my hamburgers cooked just perfectly, not well done like some places do, its so juicy, a lil pink in the middle just how I like it, just like my steaks. Yummy.

Everyone has their own take on chain restaurants. Some hate them and some love them.  For this instance. I loved my visit here at Red Robin.  I got the Red Robin Royal Cut Burger. Why this burger? It had a fried egg added to it...That sold me on it=)  My wife got the sliders.  Food wise. What can I say it was good for what it was..... Burgers and fries.   Service. Now this is where there chain restaurants fail most of the time but for my visit. It surprisingly did not. My strawberry lemonade was always full and the waitress made sure to check on us but not be bothersome. Hell, at some chains you get the initial check and that's it and the next time you see them is when you are paying.  Would I be back. I would say yes but as long as the service stays the same.
Have had so many events here for my daughter and it is always a good time! they have great customer service and always are very helpful and treat us great!!

My girlfriend and I went for lunch. I was disappointed to find they no longer had their French Onion Soup! :-(  I had Buzzard wings that weren't quite done, I didn't complain just asked if they'd cook them a bit more. The waiter was quite friendly and the Manager came over brought fresh new hot well done wings I was a happy camper. Tasted the Garlic Humus OMG that's what I'm having next time

I usually LOVE Red Robin but I'm writing this review because of the horrible experience I've had here today. Not with the food, but with the service. The husband and I decided to grab a late lunch. My husband ordered a beer for us to share. Our waitress Noelle asked for his ID which never really happens as my husband looks older than 21. When he took his ID out we realized his licenses was expired (by less than a month). I took my licenses out so we could get the beer and I even mentioned to our waitress several times that we would be sharing the beer! Not once did she say he wouldn't be able to drink because of his expired licenses! The licenses expired but his age didn't! Nonetheless, if she would have informed us that legally he wasn't allowed to drink we would have abided by the law! We wouldn't want to get anyone in trouble! Instead she sent the manager over to tell us my husband couldn't share my beer (which he only had a few sips!)! We had no idea it was a problem because again my husbands DOB clearly shows he is over 21! Expired or not. Again, if the waitress who I told we would be sharing would had said something to us at the beginning it would all have been avoided! Instead she completely avoided our table. When we finally flagged someone down and asked for the check she sent other servers to collect payment! I have never felt so uncomfortable! To make matters worse she obviously was still attending our section as she went to every table but ours! I asked to speak with the manager as this situation did not sit well with me! I explained we had no idea he couldn't drink as his birthday isn't invalid and he was over 21 and they had served me the beer! Noelle neglected to tell her manager I had mentioned we would be sharing the beer and (And AGAIN!) she never said we legally couldn't. The manager really couldn't do anything to make the situation better at that point but did say if I had bad service I should tip accordingly. I've never not tip! I usually over tip but today I left her $0! Considering she didn't do anything but take our order and make us feel uncomfortable I feel it was only fair! She completely mishandled the situation. It will be a very long time, if ever, before I return.

For a burger in a casual place...stop in.  The service is good...and the managers roam around and will check on you and your experience.  My friend introduced me to the garlic parm fries..they are really good.   The staff are fun and will chit chat..and. share laughs.  I enjoy my experience here everytime.

I'm officially done with Red Robin. I will no longer let them trick me into going here again with their bottomless fries!! Every single time I come here I keep expecting something different. I hope the service will be good, the burgers to be better, and their drinks to not be watered down. But, no! The keep doing it to me. On my last visit, I ordered a Fat Tire. It was completely watered down. And when I got my burger, I only got 5 fries. I get it, the fries are bottomless. "Then don't make me wait 20 minutes for another basket of fries!" They weren't even that busy! I was going to give it 2 stars, but too many people have given this place 5. I think not.

Red Robin has a decent selection of food and drinks on their menu and the fact that you can alter everything to make it your own with all the options they have.... Gives you an almost endless menu! Who doesn't love that!

I had the chophouse burger the menu said dressing was a horseradish sauce taste like a bbq the wife's sweet potato fries were almost ice cold.  Help was pleasant, but never offered a refill on never ending fries or ice tea. my burger was very  greasy. Very Very noisy seemed like TV was on and a radio at the same time. Good place for groups but over priced.  No reason for us to go back.

Burgers are alright, really only go for the tower of rings and endless fries. Staff is always very friendly though kind of lack to refill fries. Join the red royalty club and get a free burger for your birthday! =)

just went here tonight for the first time (ive been to others but not the one in chino) and i probably wont be going back.   i ordered the pub burger, which is new on the menu and comes with mushrooms, onions, tomatoes, and cheddar cheese i believe.   the waiter was great.  he was attentive and kept refilling my water.  i usually drink like 5-6 glasses of water for every meal and he refilled it 5-6 times.  he even gave us extra baskets of fries. the reason why i wont be coming back to this location is because when the waiter took our order, he specifically asked how we wanted our burger.  two people, including myself, ordered the pub burger and i ordered mine medium rare while the other ordered their's medium well.  when the server from the kitchen brought out the burgers, he just handed us both pub burgers.  i asked him which burger was medium rare and which was medium well.  his response?  "the burgers all come out the same temperature.  they're all the same." fail.
All American mushroom burger with extra crispy fries...yum yum yum Add a hot looker waiter = more tip!!!

I love all the dipping sauces and the unlimited steak fries. I usually come for the Crispy Chicken Tender salad though. It is the best. The combination of all the ingredients and the poppy seed honey mustard dressing is perfect. Every bite is heavenly.  I do like the burgers too. However, the only time I get one is when I get a free burger coupon for my birthday.  I would definitely suggest this restaurant for big parties and parties with kids. The kids' menu is cheap and they refill mac and cheese, but I'm not sure about the other items.  Also, they have great management. I ordered to-go once and they forgot my soup. I went back to get a refund instead they give me a $25 gift card for the inconvenience. The soup I believe was less than $5. I would of came back even if they just refunded my soup.

I placed my phone order at 7:17pm and was told it would take approximately 20 minutes. I walked in to the restaurant at 7:38pm, check was printed up and paid for by 7:45pm, but I waited until 8:12pm to get my food!!! 55 minutes for a to-go order?!?! I could have sat down and ate...but wait, I was taking food home to my family! This is NOT the first time I have received poor service from this Red Robin...but today reaffirms why I don't and will no longer eat at this establishment!

LOVE THIS PLACE!!! My favorite place to get a burger...hands down...The Bleu Ribbon Burger is the best...There speckled Lemonade is THE MOST AMAZING lemonade I've ever had...They bar is AMAZING and gives me my drinks pretty stiff...The food is always amazing and the service is even better...Hot girls waiting and a very good place for younger people...I recommend this place to EVERYONE!!!

Since joining the Red Royalty Club last month, I have been finding excuses to go to Red Robin. Recently, I treated my children (age 14 & 12) to lunch. During our order, I also put in a to-go order for my mom. We ate our delicious lunch and my to-go order arrived the same time as my bill. After paying my bill, my husband texted me that he, too, wanted me to bring home lunch for him. Noelle graciously took my last second request and put it in immediately. Bonus for me: it was free, thanks to my Red Royalty card. As we sat waiting for our last order, I realized I inadverdantly ordered my husband's burger with a regular bun instead of the available Gluten Free bun! His order was almost completed by the time I notified the kitchen my huge mistake. Noelle and the (female) manager got out the "allergy book" so I could verify the ingredients in his burger and quickly stopped the order and revised my request. I'm am certain they had to make a new burger. The male manager on duty was the one who "stopped the presses" and made sure all allergens were tended to. He soon brought out my husbands order and I apologized profusely for my mistake. He assured me that everything was okay and wished me a wonderful rest of my day. I appreciate Noelle, and the two managers quick response and how they painstakingly made certain my husband's order was correct. I really wish I had ascertained their names!! They deserve kudos for a job well done!

I love this place! Service has almost always been excellent & the food is always excellent. The Prime Chophouse Burger is amazing, but will only be around for a while. My usual is the California Chicken Burger w/ sliced avocados rather than the guacamole. Bottomless fries come w/ all the burgers, but not necessarily w/ all the dishes & you can order them as an appetizer w/o being charged. The wait is never too bad & parking is...well as good as it is any other place. This is my "go to" place for just about any family event.

I love the mushroom burger at Red Robin. Best place ever! But I'm writing this review, because of the horrible experiences I've had here. Not with the food, but with the service. Every time I come to Red Robin, something goes wrong. But I've noticed that when I had a male server, he gets the job done right. When a female server serves me, everything goes wrong. && its annoying! I used to be a server & even if I was having a bad day, I'd still put on that smile & be the nicest person ever. Because if you really look at it, I HATE bad service, so why would I give bad service. && that's all I have to say.
Place is great to take with kids. Love the fries.
I love coming here and ordering a burger to go and drinking a beer while I wait... Good food made quick. Bleu Ribbon burger.. great flavor

used to work here, so i should know: this red robin definitely have super service. the employees and the management truly go out of their way to make sure you have an amazing meal there. the wait shouldn't be long whatsoever, the drinks should arrive in less than two minutes, and your burger even "smiles" at you!  my fave choices? (after all, i got to have all foods for fifty percent off!) the banzai burger, the caesar salad with blackened salmon... there's so much great things here.  one unfortunate? all of the managers i worked with, all transferred elsewhere, and all of my fellow employees are mostly gone, too. and i haven't been back since early last year, so i'm not sure how great it is now...
Love this place! It can be pretty busy during a lot of peak hours but the service is still quick.  The food is delicious and garlic fries are unlimited!

I always like the food here, it just bothers me to pay $9 for a burger. We usually split one, since they are huge, and that makes it a bit better. Endless fries are nice. The servers seem to have improved over that last year, but the fact that there are about 3 hostesses at the door all standing there chatting and ignoring customers always starts the dinner off poorly for me.

I'd have to blame my friends and me for the noise. The lot of us usually go here for a celebration or just for any occasion. The food, or at least I believe it to be, is actually quite excellent. I mean, not enough to have me do a Meg Ryan in a restaurant (whoever recognizes the movie reference, kudos to you). However, what really, REALLY makes me love this place is the steak fries. Endless steak fries. I love French Fries, most especially when they're so big that you could stab a man in the eye with them. And endless. Good God, I am a french fry freak, and soon as I found out about this, I was in heaven. Baskets after baskets of fries. And to top it all off, REAL strawberry lemonade. REAL STRAWBERRIES IN YOUR LEMONADE! And endless! They're endless too! .... Mmm... You know what, next time I go to that restaurant, I'm going to ask if both the Steak Fries and Strawberry Lemonade are endless. Then, when they answer yes, and as soon as the food comes to my table, maybe, just maybe, I'll pull a "When Harry Met Sally" and fake one...

People - there is good food out there - REALLY! Not here though...  I stopped for a quick lunch after a meeting in the area.  It was anything but quick though.  Everything seemed busy and disorganized from the get go.  I was offered a booth in the bar area which was fine.  My "server" as it turns out was a very busy bartender so I was largely ignored and had to resort to flagging down passing employees - no managers in sight.  My Asian-ish chicken salad was over dressed and bland.  The chicken could not have been more mushy and flavorless.  I think you have to work to get this much flavor cooked OUT of chicken. Got drug back here again shortly after - service marginally better but food still pretty bland.  Beer selection is awful and wine isn't worth mentioning.  Can't these places put just a few interesting beers or wines on their menu?  It's a big chain is everyone in management/corporate completely out of touch?? An uninspiring menu that is anything but unique and painfully ordinary - what is there to like??

We love Red Robin.  One of the few places we can all get what we like!  The kid's menu is fab. for a "burger place".  It has some really good pizza that my son loves.   If you haven't tried the Strawberry Lemonade YOU ARE MISSING OUT!!!  A must have!!!  I usually have 3-4 of them...YUMMY!!!

Great food love how many of the items on the menu come with bottomless steak fries which are delicious and the towering onion rings are to die for. I usually get clucks and fries which themselves are great but I began to try the burger there and I will always now get a burger they are to good to not want to have.
Giant Tower of Delicious Onion Rings...YuM!!!! Haven't had their burgers because they are Soooo big...But will definately come back soon to try it out!!

we have been here few time and every time we came my family and i been very happy with the value of the food, taste  and they make great drink at the bar . WE LOVE IT ! at time there is a wait to be seat most time but you will have a great time and service ! thanks Red Robin .
all i gotta say is BEST SERVICE EVER :) ask for jaime. i also got a large strawberry lemonade in a to-go cup!
the one in chino hills is awesome !1 especially the waiter Myk he is the best and totally take care of you . every time we go now we always request his tables

great burgers. great drinks. love there unlimited fries they give you when you order a burger. service is always usually good. been coming here for awhile now. only down side is they don't really have an appealing happy hour.
eh, just typical red robin.  food was fine but: slow service on the fries, so you have to go up and ask for more... needed to get refills on my water myself a few times...

all I have to say is...... i love their STRAWBERRY LEMONADE! very sweet and they usually give a lot of strawberries. I love their seasoned fries and I ask for the buffalo sauce ( i always forget what its called so I say the orange sauce haha) the apple chicken salad thingy is soooooo good. i always tell my boyfriend how i think that their burgers are better then Islands...he is a BIG islands fan.  I just think the burgers are juicier and not dry.

Burgers are fantastic!! I've never had one that I didnt like. I honestly can't think of a better place that serves burgers. Top notch! This location is great! Service is always perfect. Always a good experience. I will continue to go as long as I can. The take out is always fast too! - Best of all, the free refill root beer floats for $2.99.
We always go here on b -days and the servers are REALY nice I recomend u go here over any other red robin

We ate here for lunch about 12:30 pm. The place was busy, but not overcrowded. The waitress was quick about getting our drinks and to our amazement, our food arrived about 5-10 minutes after ordering. And it was good!! We left full and happy.

I had a late lunch @ RR, as we were coimng thru the first doors, one of the servers opened our door, & promprly sat us, its a weekday so in genreal it seems always slow,our waitress Brook , was super nice & then her back up Evan as well, they took our order quick, as in the gave just the rightamount of time to make our slecetions, the came around often enough that you can tell they wanted to provide good service, the food was delish , the appetizers as well the only thing we missed out on was dessert but thats because we were stuffed, I ve been to a couple of other RR in my area & they do not seem as focused on the customer service side of things, more in the numbers on how quick they can serve you & get the table ready for a nother custeomr. unsure of the maintenance of the bthrm since I didnt have a need to go, but the genreal eating area look well kept, RR is located in a a shopping plaza so theres plenty of parking & and locals shops to walk off the food..

They're burgers are great... yes.  They have endless steak fries... yes.  But let me tell you... Red Robin has the best STRAWBERRY LEMONADE... EVER!  It's not just pink lemonade...   Its lemonade... with a scoopful of actual strawberries!!  Who does that!?  When I get my strawberry lemonade from Red Robin... I feel loved.  They care.   They put real strawberries in it...  its amazing.
Same old Red Robin - but is a good place to go for a quick dinner!

Came here for a business lunch.  I was recommended the Whiskey River BBQ Hamburg, but since I had a similar one at Carl's, I got the Chicken version of it, with a peach drink.  The fries were refillable, and so were the drinks.  The waitress was so so nice, and must have brought me five refills without me even asking once.

food is decent, but the place is too big and too loud. the location isnt as good as the eastridge one. there were TVs on the ceiling, christina aguilera blasting through the sound system, and a little girl (who is too big for the booster seat) who flung her food around like monkeys flinging poo at the zoo. that night, i had the soup and salad for dinner and the clam chowder was surprising good! it was creamy,had the right texture to it, and it didnt taste like someone spilled the all the contents of the salt shaker into my bowl!  make sure someone at your party orders a burger. aside from the extensive menu (which is somewhat parallel to island's burgers), it comes with BOTTOMLESS STEAK FRIES! woo! the wait was a bit long and the restaurant does get crowded early and fast! going there on a friday night for dinner was a big mistake.  oh yeah, the strawberry lemonade rocks!

Love the steak fries here.  Seasoned to perfection.  If you are talking about burgers you will be compared to Islands and this place hold it's own just enough to be competitive.  It caters to children more so that is very good for them. Good variety os burger styles and great service.

This is a great place for families.  I have a 3 year old boy and we go on Tuesday nights because we know "Red Robin" is going to be there to greet the kids.  The food is always good and who doesn't love all you can eat fries.  I do have one downfall.  I never know what to order because I love everything there.  Also I'm so stuffed after my dinner that I never have room for dessert.  I've also joined their birthday club and I got a free burger for my birthday.  That was a great plus.  Red Robin never goes wrong and the employees here are attentive and always get us what we need.  My favorites on the menu are the Chicken Ceasar Wrap and Clam Chowder Soup, the Royal Red Robin Burger, and the Fish and Shrimp Duo.  Like I said everything is good, but If I had to choose my top 3 those would be it.

been there a few times, always have good service with friendly waiter/waitress. Food is pretty decent also, sometimes it can take a while for food/drink to come out. But overall pretty decent with service and food.

A new favorite in our house!! I've had RR randomly throughout the years, but over the last few months, the one in Chino has become a weekly must! It started with an obsession with the Gingerbread shakes YUMM!!.. and endless steak fries... wow!! but we've always had great and friendly service which keeps us coming back. Plus, my little munchkin loves talking to "Red" on Tuesday and Thursday nights..

I know you haven't tried every single burger on their menu. I have, and they're all worth the the $8-9 each. You can't beat bottomless steak fries either. Maybe it's just this Chino location but they have consistently good service and food. The wait time here (Friday, Saturday nights esp) may be longer than most so keep that in mind.
